content.description:
Start on the right undercling and left crimp rail also used for Poop Deck. Move up into the right slanting xeno, then either use intermediates or make a big move to a juggy rail near the apex of the face. Top out directly with a chill mantel.

Center Mast Boulder Problems
content.location: Start holds indicated and are shared with Poop Deck.

content.description:
Start on a right undercling and left crimp rail, both at chest/head height. Move to a right slanting xeno, kick out to a good foot at the bottom of the left arete, and work your way up the arete. Top out above the start for an easy mantel. Very enjoyable movement!

Center Mast Boulder Problems
Beautiful Culp Valley Coarse Granite rock. Work your way up the West facing wall and descend easily on the SE side. The crux is the first move of the problem.
content.location: West face. starting with left hand on high crimp and right hand on the flake. As seen in picture.

content.description: Great rock with a strong flake up to a solid black protuberance ledge that leads you to topping out. Descend on the SE side of the rock. Has morning shade.
content.location: West face of boulder. Match both hands to the high flake.

content.description: Sit stat low on the two lowest noticable crimps. Toe or heel lock the left wall and do your best to hold the start to get your left hand up to the standing start. Hard move due to the slight overhang and lack of feet placements. A must try when coming out. I loved this climb.
content.location: Low on the West facing wall

content.description:
A lower extension to Crows Nest sit start. Start right hand on the furthest left crimp of Crows Nest sit start. Left hand begins on a low left sidepull (just left of where many people heel hook the sit start). Move through a great sidepull ledge and the crimps of Crows Nest sit to the flake and up.

Center Mast Boulder Problems
